instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Water damaged. Arrived with no light on charger. Replaced U7100 U5110.  Reballed original SMC but no change. Also replaced SMC from donar but still no change. SMC_RESET_L 3.3V. There was no water damage in SMC area

PPBUS_G3H 8.22V
SMC_RESET_L 3.3V.
PP3V42_G3H 3.42v

Should SMC be replaced again from another donar or should something else be checked first?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Sounds like bad SMC to me. JTAG removed?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Yes JTAG is removed. Will replace SMC again tomorrow then.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Post diode mode and voltage on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Check if R7100 is good.
Did you try SMC bypass mode?
3V3_S5/SUS present?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Second SMC replacement was no change

0.490  490 SCL   SDA lines  3.4V   3.4V

r7100 good

have not  tried SMC bypass since there is no light on charger

3V3_S5 3.3V

3v3_sus  0.108V

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
error in measurements

PP3V3_S5 0.412v  diode 0.346

PP3V3_SUS 0.120V diode 0.358

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC 3.3v

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: SMC_PM_G2_EN  0V. Maby replace U7501 since SMC already replaced?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
SMC_RESET_L steady high?
If yes, try other SMC...

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Yes SMC_RESEL_L is a steady 3.4V

Replaced SMC again from another donar but still no change.

Replaced again once again after that (4th SMC now) but this time from a board that had other issues but still gave a green light. STILL no change or light. Something else must be causing SMC not to function.

Any other ideas?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Check the 4 SMC_Txx lines on page 37.
Also check PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC presence.
Diode mode to ground at SMC_PM_G2_EN?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
SMC_TCK 3.4v

SMC_TMS 3.4v

SMC_TDO 3.4v

SMC_TDI 3.4v

PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC 1.118v

SMC_PM_G2_EN 0.486

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Anything else I can check or is this a no fix?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Remove SMC and check trace continuity for SMC_PM_G2_EN to U7501.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: I would kill for all those SMC chips!

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Removed SMC and continiuity to SMC_PM_G2_EN and U7501 is good. Soldered SMC back but same results.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Remove R8140 and check again SMC_PM_G2_EN voltage.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

Be sure not short on 3V3/5V_S5, or other rail.
Is SMC detects a problem, can pull dowsn SMC_PM_G2_EN for protection reason.
Check for pulse on it (and also 3V3/5V_S5) when you connect the charger.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
No change in SMC_PM_G2_EN with R8140 removed

PP3V3_S5 0.256V

PP5V_S5 0V

no shorts

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Did you check for pulse at the moment charger is connected???

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
Pp3v3_s5_smc_vdda?
[COLOR=#000000][SIZE=12px][FONT=Whitney]SMC_BC_ACOK?[/FONT][/SIZE][/COLOR]
